What are the requirements to get a student visa in Portugal?

Students coming from countries outside the EU, EEA, and Switzerland are required to ask for a Student Visa (longer than three months and up to one year) or a Residence Permit (for stays longer than one year).

  • Step 1 : Request the Visa/Residence Permit
    Schedule an appointment at the Portuguese embassy or consulate in your home country as soon as you receive the Acceptance Letter.
  • Step 2: Documents:
    These are the main documents requested for the visa application:
    • Valid passport
    • Copy of the Residence Permit issued by other Member State of his/her residence, valid for the totality of the period of stay
    • Health Insurance of evidence in which you are covered by the National Health Service
    • Evidence of the means of subsistence
    • Evidence of having been admitted in a higher education institution under an EU mobility programme or an agreement with the higher education institution of origin
    • Evidence of tuition payment, if applicable. Depending on your nationality, duration of stay and type of service you are applying for, additional documents may be required.

The detailed information of how to get/renew a Portuguese visa can be found here:

Visa & Resident Permit in Portugal

NIF Number

The NIF (Portuguese Tax Identification Number) is a fundamental personal identification element for acts related to the opening of bank accounts, acquisition of goods or services, contracts, among others. In order to get a NIF number students will have to request it at a Serviços das Finanças desk (Financial Services) or a Loja do Cidadão (Citizen’s Store), there are several throughout the city. Students who need to open a Portuguese bank account should go to one of these public services, as soon as they arrive in Lisbon, and make their request, this is free of charge. They must take their ID/Passport with them and the proof of their current residence here in Portugal.

Where can students find an accommodation?

Here are some links that will help you finding the right accommodation:

  • Study in Lisbon: http://www.studyinlisbon.pt/en/alojamento/
  • Collegiate: https://www.collegiate-ac.pt/en/
  • Student accomodation lisbon: https://www.collegiate-ac.pt/en/student%20accommodation/lisbon/ (use the promocode:NOVA FCSH)
  • Uniplaces: https://www.uniplaces.com/d/lisbon/accommodation-near-nova-fcsh (use the promocode: NOVAFCSH10)
  • My Home in the City – *Campo Pequeno*: https://www.myhomeinthecity.pt/en-gb/home
  • SPRU – Downtown: https://www.spru.pt/
  • UHub – *Benfica*: https://uhub.eu/en/building/benfica-lisbon/

What modules are taught at NOVA University?

At NOVA University the focus is on Socio Cultural Studies in particular on the impact of technology and transition on society, culture and the individual (“Culture and Transition“) . During this period, students also are familiarized with a solid approach in social studies of science and innovation studies, sources and indicators, and thus providing the essential tools for an integrated approach to the social impact of science and innovation.

The following courses will be offered during the first semester in Lisbon:

  1. Cyberculture
  2. Cyberspace, Media and Interaction
  3. Elective Courses (1 to choose):
    3.1. Science, Innovation and Social Impact
    3.2.Introduction to Digital Methods

Ms. Fiona Smyth is a member of the TISE Secretariat and responsible for internship support of the Program at University College Dublin. For all inquiries regarding internships please do not hesitate to contact Ms. Smyth.

Assistant Administrator
School of Information &Communication Studies
fiona.smyth@ucd.ie


Student supports at UCD

UCD offers a wide range of Student Support Services:

Student Advisers – Social Sciences, Contact: Kieran Moloney (kieran.moloney@ucd.ie)
Student Health Service
Student Counselling Service
UCD Chaplaincy
UCD Students’ Union – Welfare Officer
Disability Services
Academic supports : Writing Centre, Maths Centre, UCD Library

Please find all Information about Student Supports at UCD under the following Link: https://www.ucd.ie/studentcentre/services/studentsup

UCD Global Experience

UCD Global steers and guides the global strategies of the university, providing expert leadership in partnerships and engagement, international student recruitment and support, inbound and outbound mobility, and the international elements of the student experience.

Leveraging relationships with external stakeholders, UCD Global works at the interface of the university and the international community. It supports university leaders to shape policy, works with Colleges/Schools and other support units to ensure delivery, and liaises with students and staff to measure success and impact.

With its principal office in Dublin, UCD Global also directs and manages the university’s network of Global Centres, which serve as hubs of UCD activity in North America, China, South Asia, Asia-Pacific and the Middle East.

Contact: Contact Us UCD | Enquire to pursue degree at UCD

Immigration supports

If you are coming to study in UCD and are a non EU/EEA/non Swiss national, you will need to follow the student immigration path to be compliant with the local immigration legislation and policy guidelines.

Among other requirements, you may need to apply for an entry visa. If you are staying for more than 90 days, you must register in person with your local immigration officer after your arrival in the country.

Please check the Student Immigration Timeline carefully: Visas and Immigration UCD | Apply for your student visa

Modules

In the second semester students move to Ireland to UCD, for their the social science focus ( “Ethics and Information Systems” ) to deal with on Human Technology Interactions, information and ethical issues as well as social science research methodologies. At UCD a focus lies especially on ethics and
information systems:
• assessing the impact of socio-technological and transitional processes
• strengthening science-society relationships

The following courses will be offered during the second semester in Dublin:

  1. Research Methods
  2. Information Ethics
  3. Topics in Digital Media &Communications
  4. Elective Courses (1 to choose)
    4.1. People Information and Communication
    4.2. Artificial Intelligence
    4.3. Digital Policy
  5. Internship

Internship

All students of the TISE programme are required to complete an internship during their studies. The location and the topic of the internship can be freely chosen.
Students are invited to search for the internship placements according to their preferences and interests. For those students who have difficulties in finding the internship host, UCD in collaboration with the TISE network will suggest potential placements.

  • INTERNSHIP DETAILS
    • Duration: Minimum of 6 weeks – from early May to September
    • Credits : 5 ECTS
    • Location: Anywhere in the world
    • Host: At the choice of the student but should confirmed by Coordinators at UCD

  <main id="site-content">
   <article class="section-inner post-269 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry" id="post-269">
    <div class="post-inner" id="post-inner">
     <div class="entry-content">
      <div class="wp-block-cover alignfull is-light" style="min-height:180px;aspect-ratio:unset;">
       <span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__background has-background-dim-0 has-background-dim">
       </span>
       <img alt="" class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-55" data-object-fit="cover" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="256" sizes="(max-width: 2560px) 100vw, 2560px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-scaled.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-scaled.jpg 2560w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-300x30.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1024x103.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-768x77.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1536x154.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-2048x205.jpg 2048w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-540x54.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1080x108.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1980x198.jpg 1980w" width="2560"/>
       <div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container is-layout-flow wp-block-cover-is-layout-flow">
        <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-white-color has-text-color">
         Internships
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       <strong>
        Why internship matters?
       </strong>
      </h2>
      <p>
       All students of the TISE program are required to complete a mandatory internship between their second and third semester of studies. The location and the topic of the internship can be freely chosen.
      </p>
      <p>
       <strong>
        So why an internship matters?
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       An internship helps students to promote their personal and professional growth.
      </p>
      <p>
       Some of key internship benefits include the following:
      </p>
      <ul class="wp-block-list">
       <li>
        Be able to apply practical knowledge and be equipped with new skills.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <ul class="wp-block-list">
       <li>
        Gain a better understanding of specific field of interest and have the opportunity to be part of real-life projects.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <ul class="wp-block-list">
       <li>
        It may also be a good opportunity to expand the professional network, which can be very beneficial for the future career.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <p>
       However, it’s important to work closely with the internship coordinator at UCD to ensure the chosen internship satisfies the necessary requirements of the TISE program.
      </p>
      <p>
       For all inquiries regarding internships please do not hesitate to contact Ms. Fiona Smyth at
       <a href="mailto:fiona.smyth@ucd.ie">
        fiona.smyth@ucd.ie
       </a>
      </p>
      <p>
       Ms. Fiona Smyth is a member of the TISE Secretariat and responsible for internship support of the Program at University College Dublin.
      </p>

3. Semester @ PUEB, Poland

Who are the contact persons at PUEB?

Dr Maciej Pietrzykowski is one of the academic directors of TISE. As one of your contact persons at PUEB he takes care of the organisation of the Program on site.
He is a researcher, business consultant and trainer, academic teacher at Poznan University of Economics and Business – Department of International Competitiveness. Lecturer in the areas of project management, international economics, economic policy, EU economy.

TISE Program Director at PUEB
Collegium Altum, VI piętro, pok. 616
Email: maciej.pietrzykowski@ue.poznan.pl

Ms. Blanka Cimcioch is a member of the TISE Secretariat and responsible for administrative support of the Program at NOVA University. For all inquiries (e.g., regarding visa, accommodation, bank accounts, registration) please do not hesitate to contact Ms. Cimcioch.

International Accreditation Coordinator
al. Niepodległości 10, 61-875 Poznań, building A, first floor, room 124
Email: blanka.cimcioch@ue.poznan.pl


Center for international relations

The Centre for International Relations at the University of PUEB supports international students in finding accommodation, applying for visas, etc.
All information and contacts can be found here: Contact | Poznań University of Economics and Business (ue.poznan.pl)

Modules

During the third semester students will focus on the “ Transitions in Economics”. Within this period students face the challenges of economic transition, business automation, information management, and international entrepreneurship with the help of  business simulations, game based learning, adaptive and simulation-based learning, digital playful learning and edutainment as well as digital planning tools.

The following courses will be offered during the third semester in Poznan:

  1. Applied quantitative methods for economic analysis
  2. Internet of Things
  3. International Entrepreneurship
  4. Economics of transition and institutional change
  5. Data Analysis using VBA
  6. Elective courses (2 to choose)
    6.1. Data mining with R
    6.2. Edutainment and Applied Game Theory: Strategic Games
    6.3. Fintech and on-demand economy in philosophical context
    6.4. Game theory
    6.5. International Economics and Globalization
    6.6. Big Data and Internet surveys
    6.7. Microeconomics of Competitiveness
    6.8. Multimedia in Business
    6.9. Elements of probability simulation and Bayesian modelling using R
    6.10. Project Planning and Management
    6.11. R programming

4. Semester @ UWK, Austria

Who are the contact persons at UWK?

Mag. Kay Mühlmann is the initiator of the Transition Innovation and Sustainability Network of European Higher Education Institutions and Coordinator of the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master of Excellence “Transition, Innovation and Sustainability Environments”. He is responsible for the organisation of the TISE Program. Furthermore he has a leading role in the establishment of the European Communications Institute, ECI (2018), in Athens Greece, a Synergy of Athena Research and Innovation Centers in Information and Communication Technologies, the National Technical University of Athens and Danube University with the goal to implement new transdisciplinary approaches in teaching and research for complex problem solving in societal contexts.

TISE Program Director
Department for Knowledge and Communication Management
kay.muehlmann@donau-uni.ac.at

Dr. Liliya Satalkina is head of the TISE Secretariat and responsible for the administrative and organisational implementation of the TISE Program. She is a Post Doc Researcher at UWK with a focus on System Science and Innovation.

Program Manager of TISE
Department for Knowledge and Communication Management
liliya.satalkina@donau-uni.ac.at

Student Support

Student Service Center
The Infopoint of the University for Continuing Education Krems is the central contact point for students, alumni, lectures, and employees at Campus Krems.
Contact: scs@donau-uni.ac.at

Service Center for international relations
At the University for Continuing Education Krems, internationalization is of great significance and is supported by numerous international research and cooperation projects, collaborations, and exchange activities. Internationalization is to be found at all levels of the university.
Please find an overview of services and offers here: Service Center for International Relations – University for Continuing Education Krems (donau-uni.ac.at)

Visa Support
For Information regarding visa application etc in Austria please contact our colleague at Service Center for international relations:
Dr. des. Hélène Oberlé
Mobility and Inclusion Coordinator – Service Center for International Relations
helene.oberle@donau-uni.ac.at

Student Union

The student council offers service and advice and is responsible for representing the interests of students.
More Information can be found on their Website: https://www.oeh-duk.at/de/vertretung/sekretariat-2.html

Tel: +43 (0)2732 893-2045
E-Mail: buero@oeh-duk.at

Modules

At UWK a thematic emphasis is on the dynamics of (social) systems in transition and their environments (socio-cultural, socio-technical & socio-economical systems) as well as cross-boundary communication in this multiplex environment, system models and simulations as well as strategies of transdisciplinary methods and processes (“Systems Science and Transdisciplinarity”) . The main goal is to integrate the previously obtained knowledge under a complexity science umbrella.

The following courses will be offered during the third semester in Krems:

  1. Complexity Science and Social System Theories
  2. System Models, Agents of Change & Coupled Systems in Transition
  3. Transdisciplinary Field Research Training (TFRT)
  4. Master’s Thesis

Master Thesis

The TISE master’s thesis meets scientific requirements, which means review of the scientific state of the art literature, combined with the realization of an empirical study. The problem to be addressed in the master thesis should describe a complex problem area and can be rooted in one or more of TISE disciplines (disciplinary thesis, interdisciplinary thesis, transdisciplinary thesis). However, as complex as the problem area might be, the thesis must be based on a clearly defined and focused research question.

Every thesis must have two supervisors from two different institutions, either Universities of Consortium or Associated partners. In addition to that students are free to consult with other scientists or (external) experts. Students should be ready to provide their preferences regarding the MT topics (or at least research areas) not later than by the mid. of the third semester. However, it is recommended not to start reflecting on the MT topic prior to the end of the second semester. Students are also invited to make suggestions regarding the potential supervisors. However, due to organizational reasons, the final decision regarding the supervisors is made only by the Consortium.

The MTs is designed to accompany the compilation and writing process of the thesis and give the possibility of feedback, reflection and discussion with supervisors and peers. Therefore, the attendance of the master’s thesis seminars is obligatory. Overall, there are four MT seminars that are arranged during the fourth semester, with the aim of exchange and mutual learning as well as continuous update of the work progress.

Content related issues of the MT:

  • Based on a clearly specified problem (theoretical or empirical) and suggestions on how to solve it
  • Must have a clearly defined research question
  • Analysis and critical interpretation of the scientific literature referring to the chosen issue in order to establish a state of the art; so that, through scientifically validated methodologies, the degree of knowledge about the chosen problem can be improved
  • Collection, analysis and processing/interpretation of data
  • Use research methods and tools for analysis appropriate for the considered problem
  • Must include a summary and interpretation of the results of the author’s research.

     <div class="entry-content">
      <div class="wp-block-cover alignfull is-light" style="min-height:180px;aspect-ratio:unset;">
       <span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__background has-background-dim-0 has-background-dim">
       </span>
       <img alt="" class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-55" data-object-fit="cover" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="256" sizes="(max-width: 2560px) 100vw, 2560px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-scaled.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-scaled.jpg 2560w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-300x30.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1024x103.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-768x77.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1536x154.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-2048x205.jpg 2048w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-540x54.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1080x108.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1980x198.jpg 1980w" width="2560"/>
       <div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container is-layout-flow wp-block-cover-is-layout-flow">
        <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-white-color has-text-color">
         Studying in TISE
        </h1>
        <p>
        </p>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile is-vertically-aligned-bottom">
       <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
        <noscript>
         <img alt="" class="wp-image-2076 size-full" data-mwl-img-id="2076" decoding="async" height="733" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-1024x733.png" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-1024x733.png 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-300x215.png 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-768x550.png 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-540x387.png 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-1080x773.png 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1.png 1112w" width="1024"/>
        </noscript>
        <img alt="" class="lazyload wp-image-2076 size-full" data-mwl-img-id="2076" data-sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" data-src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-1024x733.png" data-srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-1024x733.png 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-300x215.png 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-768x550.png 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-540x387.png 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1-1080x773.png 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/Diversity-1.png 1112w" decoding="async" height="733" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22%20viewBox=%220%200%201024%20733%22%3E%3C/svg%3E" width="1024"/>
       </figure>
       <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
        <p>
         TISE continues to attract new participants of the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree Program from all around the globe – our students and alumni come from almost 60 different countries!
        </p>
        <p>
         This diversity in the educational backgrounds is enriching the learning experience of the students from day one – as well as studying in at least three different countries in Europe.
        </p>
        <p>
         We value diversity and inclusion for our sustainable future.
        </p>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       What studying in TISE looks like?
      </h2>
      <p>
       Our 2nd cohort has just completed their first semester of the TISE Program at Universidade NOVA de Lisboa !We asked them to share their experiences as international students and to give some advice for future applicants.
      </p>
      <p>
       <em>
        “Studying here at NOVA has been the most eye opening intellectual stimulation
       </em>
      </p>
      <figure class="wp-block-video">
       <video controls="" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/TISE_Subtitledversion.mp4">
       </video>
      </figure>
      <p>
       <strong>
        Yudai, our first Intake TISE Student offered to give an inisght into his experiences studying in the framework of an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Program:
       </strong>
      </p>
      <p>
       <em>
        ” A source of inspiration” is how I would describe this TISE programme. Learning with 27 people from 23 countries gives me fresh insights and perspectives. I decided to apply for TISE as I had been keen to aboard European ways of social innovation and entrepreneurship after working at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Denmark. The lectures and the mobility scheme have successfully laid a foundation for my understanding of the innovation process and sustainable development in multiple fields. As ‘interdisciplinarity’ is the core concept of  TISE, this programme highly encourages the development of many different areas of expertise and welcomes applicants from a diverse range of backgrounds.  After graduation, I would love the opportunity to work at a government entity to foster open innovation in the public sector.
       </em>
      </p>
      <figure class="wp-block-video">
       <video controls="" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/tise-.mp4">
       </video>
      </figure>
      <div class="wp-block-cover alignfull is-light" style="min-height:180px;aspect-ratio:unset;">
       <span aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-cover__background has-background-dim-0 has-background-dim">
       </span>
       <img alt="" class="wp-block-cover__image-background wp-image-55" data-object-fit="cover" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="256" sizes="(max-width: 2560px) 100vw, 2560px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-scaled.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-scaled.jpg 2560w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-300x30.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1024x103.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-768x77.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1536x154.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-2048x205.jpg 2048w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-540x54.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1080x108.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Balken-1980x198.jpg 1980w" width="2560"/>
       <div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container is-layout-flow wp-block-cover-is-layout-flow">

        </h1>
        <p>
        </p>

Master’s Thesis

Our TISE repository provides an online archive of our alumni Master’s Theses and research output from the Transdisciplinary Field Research Training (TFRT). The full texts are always following the approval of the relevant authors. Using structured metadata, the theses uploaded to the server get bibliographic descriptions and they are citable through a permanent and stable web address.

For more information about our official institutional repository online platform, please consult this page .

Browse the collection of TISE Master’s Theses (1st Intake)

Browse the collection of TFRT project reports.

The TISE thematic framework showcases topic clusters derived from all master’s theses in TISE. This educational resource is designed to assist students in understanding the thematic significance of TISE, while also promoting stakeholder engagement and community building around specific topics. Additionally, the framework encompasses topics related to transdisciplinary field research training .

Sustainable business practices

Different perspectives on transitions towards sustainability

Methods for investigating complex systems

Digitalization as part of sustainable societies

Sustainble social transformations

TISE to public

Conferences and events

Student conferences are extracurricular features of the TISE program with the goal of fostering a comprehensive knowledge integration.

The first student conference at the end of the second semester is self-organized by the students around the topics of the TISE program.

We proudly acknowledge the effort our students invest into this activity that is important for their professional development and for the development of the TISE Program.

Back to the Future Student Conference

Back to the Future Student Conference was organized by the third cohort of the Erasmus Mundus Master of Science in Transition, Innovation, and Sustainability Environments (TISE) at University College Dublin.

Date: April 25, 2024

The Back to the Future Conference aimed to delve into the convergence of historical insights, contemporary actions, and future projections to steer positive change and nurture a sustainable future.

The conference commenced with an engaging online session on April 25th, featuring esteemed speakers from academia, industry, and civil society who shared their perspectives on the intersection of sustainability and technology.

We thank our students for organizing an exceptional conference, and all the participants for sharing valuable insights and feedback.

TISE Student Conference: _Hacking Sustainability

Explore the agenda

The TISE student conference: _Hacking Sustainability was held online from 20 th -21 st September 2023, as an independent student initiative of the TISE Program.

The conference served as an open forum that brought together stakeholders from public, research, enterprises and organizations to come to a critical approach, concerning global issues, and inter-challenging ideas on technologies, ecosystems and societies.

We thank all the participants for making this conference a success!

Discover more about our TISE Network

CSS online Student Conference “ Collaboration for Sustainable Solutions”

On behalf of the TISE Program we are happy to invite you to join the CSS online Student Conference “ Collaboration for Sustainable Solutions” that is organized and coordinated by TISE Students.

The Conference will take place on the 9th and 10th of May 2022 in an online format in order to reach speakers and participants from all around the world. Among others, the following institutions/ speakers will support the conference and enrich it with contributions:

  • The Lord Mayor of Dublin Allison Gililand who will be the person opening the space the first day at 10 am.

       <div class="wp-block-cover__inner-container is-layout-flow wp-block-cover-is-layout-flow">
        <h1 class="wp-block-heading has-white-color has-text-color">
         News
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       <strong>
        TISE 2025 – 2027: Call for TISE self-funded students is open.
       </strong>
      </h2>
      <div class="wp-block-media-text is-stacked-on-mobile">
       <figure class="wp-block-media-text__media">
        <noscript>
         <img alt="" class="wp-image-3174 size-full" data-mwl-img-id="3174" decoding="async" height="1024" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-1024x1024.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-1024x1024.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-768x768.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-540x540.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1.jpg 1080w" width="1024"/>
        </noscript>
        <img alt="" class="lazyload wp-image-3174 size-full" data-mwl-img-id="3174" data-sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" data-src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-1024x1024.jpg" data-srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-1024x1024.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-768x768.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1-540x540.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Call-for-TISE-self-funded-students-is-open-1.jpg 1080w" decoding="async" height="1024" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22%20viewBox=%220%200%201024%201024%22%3E%3C/svg%3E" width="1024"/>
       </figure>
       <div class="wp-block-media-text__content">
        <p>
         TISE master’s program for 2025 – 2027 will be open
         <strong>
          only for self-funded students.
         </strong>
         The call for applications will be available until
         <strong>
          May 31, 2025
         </strong>
         .
        </p>
        <p>
         Before starting your application, please make sure you have all the admission requirements and documents listed on our
         <a href="https://www.tise-master.eu/for-applicants/">
          “For Applicants”
         </a>
         page where you will also find the link to our Application platform.
        </p>
        <p>
         The
         <a href="https://www.tise-master.eu/faq-and-contact/">
          FAQ
         </a>
         section also provides answers to frequently asked questions.
        </p>
        <p>
         Don’t hesitate to contact us at tise@donau-uni.ac.at for any further questions.
        </p>
       </div>
      </div>
      <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Congratulations to Cohort 4 members for winning the EY Challenge!
      </h2>
      <p>
       A special shoutout to Mahamuda Aktar, Wasif Jan, Fatma Hilal Alhusaini, and Gamaliel Kan for their incredible hard work and dedication. It was truly a pleasure to see all your efforts pay off with this well-deserved reward and the exciting summer internship opportunity at EY!
      </p>
      <p>
       Here is a small pitch from the group: We proposed to make a women-led, locally run, sanitary napkins made of banana fibers business to solve the period poverty in Zanzibar, Tanzania.
      </p>
      <p>
       Check out our
       <a href="https://www.tise-master.eu/inside-tise/tise-e-learning/">
        Internship Page
       </a>
       to read more about this exciting opportunity that can help you grow, learn, and make a real impact!
      </p>

       <noscript>

      </figure>
      <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Welcome Day TISE Intake 3!
      </h2>
      <p>
       Exciting Welcome Day for our students of Intake 3.
      </p>
      <p>
       A big thank you to our amazing colleagues from the Student Union (ÖH Donau-Uni Krems) and International Relations for joining us and introducing their teams and the incredible services they offer to our students.
      </p>
      <p>
       A special shout-out to the Student Union for organizing a beautiful Welcome Breakfast to kick off this exciting journey.  It was a wonderful way for our students to connect and start their fourth semester in Austria, after spending the previous semesters in Lisbon, Dublin and Poznan!
      </p>
      <p>
       Our students enjoyed a 2-day workshop with a tour in Krems and an excursion to Vienna.
      </p>
      <p>
       We wish our students all the best as they embark on their final semester of TISE master’s program. Best of luck and success on this last stretch of your academic journey!
      </p>

      <p>
       Field trips encourage hands-on learning experiences and deepen understanding of academic topic.
      </p>
      <p>
       This week our students of Intake 4 took their first field trip to the Karnart’s Cabinet of Curiosities in Lisbon

        Universidade
       </a>
       <a href="https://www.unl.pt/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        Nova de Lisboa, NL.
       </a>
      </p>
      <p>
       We are happy to share a photo from their nice field trip experience!
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">

      </h2>

       We are happy to welcome our new Intake who had a fantastic start to the program on September 4, 2024, at the Universidade NOVA de Lisboa!
      </p>
      <p>
       We wish our students two exciting years ahead, filled with opportunities for growth, learning, and personal development!
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       TISE 2
       <sup>
        nd
       </sup>
       Intake: Congratulations, Graduates!
      </h2>
      <p>
       Last week we celebrated our graduates of the 2nd cohort on their achievements!
      </p>
      <p>
       Our campus energy was buzzing with our excited graduates, colleagues, as well as numerous proud guests that arrived to UWK, and also joined us on-line.
      </p>
      <p>
       A big thank you to the whole TISE team for the great organization and support and to our colleagues from
       <a href="https://www.unl.pt/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
        Universidade Nova de Lisboa
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="https://www.ucd.ie/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
        University College Dublin
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="https://ue.poznan.pl/en/university/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
        Poznan University of Economics and Business
       </a>
       for the dedication and excellent collaboration in managing our TISE Program.
      </p>
      <p>
       We are happy to share some of our favorite photos from the graduation day!
      </p>
      <p>
       Congratulations, Graduates! We wish that your careers are rewarding both professionally and personally!
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Friends, smiles and a marriage.
      </h2>
      <p>
       What a wonderful opportunity for a reunion!
      </p>
      <p>
       Some of our alumni travelled to Pakistan to celebrate the marriage of their friend and former TISE colleague, Mobin. Congratulations to the happy couple and Best wishes to all of you!
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       TISE 2nd Intake: Excursion to the Wachau Valley
      </h2>
      <p>
       Rain didn’t stop the excursion for our students in the Wachau Valley!
      </p>
      <p>
       We thank the Student Union (ÖH UWK)
       <a href="https://www.facebook.com/oehuwk?__cft__[0]=AZXOW85YuATWcfPwi1h6jutceEokxAkq0I72cOZPQRmWYbcbcXd-rGsUGImDZyRtaZOSVaL54Kfeb3JlG0BbI2HAljpVHKYee5-OPgCHr5WwYfLMkgRdL38DlVlVnXSaLphbn2HaNOVXI6iQocgiP6f_E8S-bZT6iVlIQyo2TOPS9O6kaKpgQq0bm8o5N3tfdUNRshmqtkuqs8XeVjKuhYUn&__tn__=-]K-R" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        ÖH Donau-Uni Krems
       </a>
       who organized and funded the full-day trip for all our international students who are spending the summer semester in Austria.
      </p>
      <p>
       Our 2nd intake had the opportunity to spend a relaxing time together and get to know this particularly beautiful region of Austria.
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       2nd Global Transdisciplinarity Conference
      </h2>
      <figure class="wp-block-image size-full">
       <noscript>
        <img alt="" class="wp-image-2478" data-mwl-img-id="2478" decoding="async" height="534" sizes="(max-width: 1812px) 100vw, 1812px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation.jpg 1812w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-300x88.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-1024x302.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-768x226.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-1536x453.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-540x159.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-1080x318.jpg 1080w" width="1812"/>
       </noscript>
       <img alt="" class="lazyload wp-image-2478" data-mwl-img-id="2478" data-sizes="(max-width: 1812px) 100vw, 1812px" data-src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation.jpg" data-srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation.jpg 1812w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-300x88.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-1024x302.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-768x226.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-1536x453.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-540x159.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/Conference-Invitation-1080x318.jpg 1080w" decoding="async" height="534" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22%20viewBox=%220%200%201812%20534%22%3E%3C/svg%3E" width="1812"/>
      </figure>
      <p>
       As we have had the opportunity to witness the continued engagement with transdisciplinarity coming from our cohorts, we would like to extend the offer to participate in the 2
       <sup>
        nd
       </sup>
       Global Transdisciplinarity Conference between June 26
       <sup>
        th
       </sup>
       and 30
       <sup>
        th
       </sup>
       in Mustafapaşa, Cappadokia, Türkiye (or hybrid from anywhere on the globe). Further information can be found here:
       <a href="https://www.donau-uni.ac.at/en/university/faculties/business-globalization/news-events/events/recurring-events/2nd-global-transdisciplinarity-conference.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
        https://www.donau-uni.ac.at/en/university/faculties/business-globalization/news-events/events/recurring-events/2nd-global-transdisciplinarity-conference.html
       </a>
      </p>
      <p>
       As the conference is by invitation only and has a limited number of participants, please contact
       <a href="mailto:ilja.steffelbauer@donau-uni.ac.at">
        ilja.steffelbauer@donau-uni.ac.at
       </a>
       if you are interested. We are extending this offer specifically to TISE-students in order to strengthen the role of young and early career scholars in the fields of transdisciplinarity, science-society-collaboration and knowledge integration in our conference.
      </p>
      <p>
       Organizers: Gerald Steiner, Ilja Steffelbauer.
      </p>

        </figure>
       </div>
       <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:66.66%">
        <p>
         The application process was very competitive!
        </p>
        <p>
         Altogether, we received 502 eligible applications, of which only 21 were nominated for a scholarship.
        </p>
        <p>
         Congratulations to all scholarship-winners!
        </p>
        <p>
         We would like to thank all the applicants for the participation and kindly remind that it still possible to apply for the TISE intake 2024 as a Consortium Scholarship holder (Deadline: 31.05.2024 23:59 CET) or as a self-funded student (Deadline: 30.06.2024 23:59 CET). In both cases, please follow the TISE Application Guidelines on our Website and submit your application into the relevant section on the TISE Moodle Platform.
        </p>
       </div>
      </div>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       First TISE Graduation August 2023
      </h2>
      <p>
       We are happy to share that our TISE Program has celebrated its first graduation! This August, our pioneering cohort, with 26 wonderful students out of 23 countries, have completed their two-year journey in TISE. After the four exciting semesters, we were happy to celebrate this important event with our students, colleagues, as well as numerous guests that arrived to UWK, but also joined us on-line.
      </p>
      <p>
       We congratulate our graduates and wish them all the very best for their future! It was pleasure to witness your professional and personal growth. We are proud of all the accomplishments that you have achieved as well as all the milestones that you have reached during these two years. We are happy that you were our first students, and we are eager to hear about your future success in making our world better!
      </p>
      <p>
       We are grateful to the whole TISE Team and our great colleagues from Universidade Nova de Lisboa, University College Dublin, and Poznan University of Economics and Business for all their efforts and constant support in managing our TISE Program.
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       New TISE Program Representative: Shuvro Sen
      </h2>
      <div class="wp-block-columns is-layout-flex wp-container-core-columns-is-layout-2 wp-block-columns-is-layout-flex">
       <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:33.33%">
        <figure class="wp-block-gallery has-nested-images columns-default is-cropped wp-block-gallery-8 is-layout-flex wp-block-gallery-is-layout-flex">
         <figure class="wp-block-image size-large">
          <noscript>
           <img alt="" class="wp-image-1802" data-mwl-img-id="1802" decoding="async" height="1024" sizes="(max-width: 887px) 100vw, 887px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-887x1024.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-887x1024.jpg 887w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-260x300.jpg 260w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-768x887.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-1330x1536.jpg 1330w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-1774x2048.jpg 1774w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-540x624.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-1080x1247.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1.jpg 1971w" width="887"/>
          </noscript>
          <img alt="" class="lazyload wp-image-1802" data-mwl-img-id="1802" data-sizes="(max-width: 887px) 100vw, 887px" data-src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-887x1024.jpg" data-srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-887x1024.jpg 887w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-260x300.jpg 260w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-768x887.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-1330x1536.jpg 1330w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-1774x2048.jpg 1774w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-540x624.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1-1080x1247.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Shuvro-Sen-1.jpg 1971w" decoding="async" height="1024" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22%20viewBox=%220%200%20887%201024%22%3E%3C/svg%3E" width="887"/>
         </figure>
        </figure>
       </div>
       <div class="wp-block-column is-layout-flow wp-block-column-is-layout-flow" style="flex-basis:66.66%">
        <p>
         Shuvro Sen is a highly accomplished individual who has recently completed his Erasmus Mundus Master’s degree in Transition, Innovation, and Sustainability Environment (TISE) in 2023. Hailing from Bangladesh, he has a strong educational background, having obtained his undergraduate degree in Management and post-graduation in Strategic and International Management from the prestigious University of Dhaka.
        </p>
        <p>
         With a passion for research and sustainable development, Mr. Sen has gained valuable experience as a Research Associate in the project “The Regulation of International Supply Chain (RISC),” which was funded by the Danish International Development Agency (DANIDA). His dedication to research led him to publish 11 journal articles and 1 book chapter as of now, with a total citation count of 1150+ and 8 h-index. Furthermore, Mr. Sen has actively participated in the Friedrich-Ebert-Stiftung (FES) Bangladesh as a Research Fellow, where he successfully led his own research projects. Alongside his academic pursuits, he is currently serving as the Coordinator of Public Relations at the Erasmus Mundus Association Bangladesh, showcasing his strong organizational and communication skills.
         <br/>
         <br/>
         Driven by a desire to gain industry experience in the field of Supply Chain, Mr. Sen is now seeking opportunities to apply his knowledge and expertise in a practical setting. With his academic experience and research background, he is well-equipped to contribute to the industry and make a meaningful impact in the area of Supply Chain management.
        </p>
        <p>
         <em>
          <strong>
           If you want to contact Mr. Sen for questions about the TISE application process or other informations, please contact him via Mail
           <a href="mailto:tise@em-a.eu" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
            tise@em-a.eu
           </a>
          </strong>
         </em>
        </p>
       </div>
      </div>
      <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Open application period: Self funded Students
      </h2>
      <div class="wp-block-group">
       <div class="wp-block-group__inner-container is-layout-flow wp-block-group-is-layout-flow">
        <p>
         The application period for participation In TISE as a self-funded student will be open until June 30,2023. Please find more Information
         <a href="https://www.tise-master.eu/cost-and-funding/other-funding-opportunities/" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">
          here
         </a>
         .
        </p>
        <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
       </div>
      </div>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Open application period: Consortium Scholarships
      </h2>
      <p>
       Our next application phase is already open! The application period for Consortium Scholarships will be open until May 31st! Please find more information about the scholarship
       <a href="https://www.tise-master.eu/cost-and-funding/other-funding-opportunities/">
        here
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Erasmus scholarship holders for the Intake 2023 have been selected!
      </h2>
      <p>
       In April, our Admission Board made the final decision on the applicants nominated for an Erasmus scholarship for the Intake 2023. All applicants were subsequently informed of the result via email.The application process was very competitive. Altogether, we received 381 eligible applications, of which only 21 were nominated for a scholarship.
      </p>
      <hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       TISE Intake 2 successfully started!
      </h2>
      <p>
       We are happy to announce that our students of the second TISE intake had a wonderful start into their semester at the Universidade NOVA de Lisboa!
      </p>
      <p>
       During the Introductory Week, the programme directors introduced their institutions and the focus of their specialization. In the second week, the Design thinking workshop by Politecnico di Milano – School of Design was provided!
      </p>
      <p>
       We congratulate our students and wish them a lot of inspiration and luck during their two year TISE journey!
      </p>

      <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
       Start of the TISE Program 2021
      </h2>
      <p>
       The first
       <strong>
        TISE introductory
       </strong>
       <strong>
        week
       </strong>
       took place at
       <strong>
        Universidade NOVA de Lisboa
       </strong>
       in the week of September 6th-10th. The members of the Consortium introduced themselves and gave first insights into the respective courses that will be taught at each partner institution:
       <strong>
        Universidade NOVA de Lisboa, University college Dublin, Poznan University of Business and Economics and Danube University Krems
       </strong>
       .
      </p>
      <figure class="wp-block-image">
       <noscript>
        <img alt="" class="wp-image-809" data-mwl-img-id="809" decoding="async" height="575" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1024x575.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1024x575.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-300x168.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-768x431.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1536x862.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-2048x1150.jpg 2048w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-540x303.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1080x606.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1980x1112.jpg 1980w" width="1024"/>
       </noscript>
       <img alt="" class="lazyload wp-image-809" data-mwl-img-id="809" data-sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" data-src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1024x575.jpg" data-srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1024x575.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-300x168.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-768x431.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1536x862.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-2048x1150.jpg 2048w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-540x303.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1080x606.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3764-1980x1112.jpg 1980w" decoding="async" height="575" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns=%22http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%22%20viewBox=%220%200%201024%20575%22%3E%3C/svg%3E" width="1024"/>
      </figure>
      <p>
       The introduction was followed by a week in which our colleagues from
       <strong>
        PoliDESIGN Milan
       </strong>
       held a workshop on design thinking – specifically design for sustainable transition.
      </p>
      <p>
       Almost all students were able to participate during the first weeks and used first workshops to get to know their colleagues!
      </p>
      <p>
       We are happy to welcome
       <strong>
        28 members of the first TISE intake
       </strong>
       and are looking forward to starting a new adventure of the TISE program!
      </p>
      <figure class="wp-block-image">
       <noscript>
        <img alt="" class="wp-image-797" data-mwl-img-id="797" decoding="async" height="683" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-1024x683.jpg" srcset="https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-300x200.jpg 300w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-768x512.jpg 768w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-2048x1365.jpg 2048w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-540x360.jpg 540w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-1080x720.jpg 1080w, https://www.tise-master.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/IMG_3710-1-1980x1320.jpg 1980w" width="1024"/>

Development Opportunities

Student development covers a variety of learning opportunities.

We support our student development through opportunities that augment the learning experience, improving the knowledge and skills sets.

Explore the opportunities around TISE Program that will help you reach your professional goals.

DeL Summer School

The Summer School addresses High Potentials (undergraduates, graduates, doctoral/phd students) and interested professionals who will have the opportunity to discuss and work on case studies on current legal problems in the areas of Data Law, Data Protection and Cybersecurity, Transnational Business Law and Innovation and IP Strategy.

We asked our TISE graduate, Thandiwe Majama, to rate her experience at DeL Summer School, and we are proud to share her positive and valuable feedback:

„ As a TISE student, I seized the opportunity to attend the DEL Summer School, which enhanced my understanding of EU data regulations, cybersecurity, and transnational business law—topics I initially encountered in TISE’s 2nd semester. The summer school complemented my UCD courses from the second semester on digital policy, information ethics, and media. It also provided a valuable networking opportunity with fellow students and professionals from Austria, Germany, Lithuania, and the Czech Republic, where we discussed potential ways to leverage my undergraduate degree and TISE experience for a career in data and technology regulation“.

For more information about the school and the funding opportunity within the program, please contact DeL Summer School .

Manfred on Tour

Manfred On Tour is a pioneer social and youth organisation based in Logroñ (Spain), which aims to empower the youth through the development of European programs of exchange and partnership to encourage fruitful and reliable co-working, and to improve the opportunities of the youngsters in the academic, market and political sectors.

This group of young entrepreneurs full of great ideas, enthusiasm and professionalism is always looking for young people to participate in exchange projects or intern with the team and help them reimagine the rural futures while unleashing your potentials and building life-long intercultural friendships.

The main activities of their programs include: a rural co-living house, rural biodiversity protection, bio-intensive farming and gardening, youth development, rural community development and reforestation mainly to fight depopulation and promote sustainability in rural Spain.

For more information, visit the website Manfred On Tour

Miguel Lucea is graduated in Transition Innovation Sustainability of Environments Erasmus Mundus Master of excellence with a strong focus on sustainable development and educational social change.

He founded the Spanish non-profit organisation Manfred On Tour and manages the pilot rural development project “Co-living Sojuela Joven”: a youth lab in the mountains of northern Spain sponsored by the government of La Rioja.

Miguel Lucea and his team involve young people in development opportunities to raise awareness on different issues, and build an inclusive, egalitarian and intercultural society.

The European Commission

We invite our students to explore more opportunities to gain practical and professional experience within the traineeship program at the European Commission.

         <span class="cmplz-always-active">
          <span class="cmplz-banner-checkbox">
